content:
According to the spec, the type level _history-interaction
GET [base]/[type]/_history{?[parameters]&_format=[mime-type]}
supports the parameters
_count
_at
_since

I can see UseCases, where a system would want to poll a server for "new Labresults" or "any Patient updates where serviceProvider = Organisation 123"
But adding any criteria to the interaction would be illegal, if I read the spec correctly.

GET [base]/Patient/_history?_since=[timestamp]&organization=123
is not allowed?

Hm. ok. I'm not saying I have a strong use case here, just thinking aloud...
If I'd want to be updated on a specific subset of Patients, I could regularly poll for e.g.
/Patient?organization=123&lastUpdate=gt[timestampOfLastQuery] an receive all changed or newly created Patient resources relevant to my Organization.
...but I'd miss all Patients leaving my Organization.
Same would be true for the _history-interaction (assuming the additional criteria was allowed)
That's why I'd alway want to process the full _history even if I care only about a small subset or resources.
Thoughts I'd had was to use the _list search parameter in the context of the history, then no issues, and then have another process managing the inclusion/exclusion on the list.
